abstract: As appealing as à la carte cable may sound, there is a reason that Congress has not taken the bait: it would be a consumer disaster.
snippet: As appealing as à la carte cable may sound, there is a reason that Congress has not taken the bait: it would be a consumer disaster.
lead_paragraph: Twice in the last few months, I’ve written columns about the bitter “carriage dispute” between the NFL Network and the nation’s two largest cable companies, Comcast and Time Warner. This column, I swear, is not going to be the third in a series. As annoyed as I remain over the tactics of the National Football League, I’ve had my say.

headline.main: Bland Menu if Cable Goes à la Carte
headline.print_headline: Bland Menu If Cable Goes À la Carte
